metadata.Title: CVE-2023-29400 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Templates containing actions in unquoted HTML attributes (e.g. "attr={{.}}") executed with empty input can result in output with unexpected results when parsed due to HTML normalization rules. This may allow injection of arbitrary attributes into tags.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-29400` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

golang-1.20 - 1.20.3-1ubuntu0.1~22.04
golang-1.20-go - 1.20.3-1ubuntu0.1~22.04
golang-1.20-src - 1.20.3-1ubuntu0.1~22.04
No subscription required

criterions.comment: golang-1.20 package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.20.3-1ubuntu0.1~22.04').
